description: Works great, sounds great
cleaner style, logo and name. Glimpse can now be used in professional and education settings, and the other aim of glimpse is to make a cleaner more modern UI.
summary: So glad there is a better named version

description: Its just a different name for a existing software GIMP
Better name, better interface, better position to be in. Much preferred.
Thank you for this! Now please add multiple layers selection since we can NOW have it ! They never added it, were they paid by adobe for not adding this? My God...
in color management settings, can't access system or .local folders where icc monitor profiles are stored. wish someone would package as a regular .deb instead of snap
summary: can't access needed directories due to sandboxing

description: GIMP's UI always felt clunky in weird ways to me for no good reason. the usability enhancements, inoffensive name, and positive community are all solid improvements.
There is something wrong with the world when you have to fork a program because some jockstrap find the work Gimp offensive.
You just renamed a program without changing the code just because it offended you. Good going you bunch of goofs.
Much better name... The SNAP works great!

I am very glad that this project has started and have thought for years that it is something that needed to be done. I am a huge supporter and I hope that this project sees the success that LibreOffice did when they forked from OpenOffice.

renamed a well known app because of .... no thanks
just a rename without development 
no thanks
summary: renamed a well known app because of .... no thanks

description: This is the work of a group of other people given a new name and a new icon. Not a fan of that. I'm sure their intentions are good, but this entire thing is pointless. Just use GIMP and if you're worried about the name, when someone asks explain it's GNU Image Manipulation Program.
Soy modification of GIMP... Just use GIMP.

It is just a copy of GIMP called GLIMPSE because somebody didn't like the name GIMP. That would be ok, but please do not pretend like it's anything else. At least add it to the description of the app that it is a 1:1 fork more clearly if not i would be interested in the list of changes. So if somebody says the UI is better the before. GIMP has the same interface.

Finally feel ok about the Photoshop alternative. Everything feels smoother, more intuitive. As everyone's pointed out already... better name, can be taken more seriously. Not to mention that there's no lame mascot.

Only thing left is to make it come with Photoshop shortcuts by default. And with the smart-selection plugin.

Because the phrase "gimp" was deemed "offensive", some social justice warriors forked the best free & open source photo editing software the world has ever seen. More power to them because that is what OSS is all about. However, making a big stink and saying that this forked piece of software is "so much better" because the name "glimpse" hasn't been deemed offensive as of March 2020 is the very cancer that will metastasize and ruin the whole thing.
summary: Social justice cancer infected the FOSSorld

description: Finally a simple, yet intuitive graphing editing program for linux, that just works
This is a true shame, the program is a copy of GIMP with a different name and loading screen. Don't even know why this is relevant.
summary: It is exactly like GIMP but with a different name

description: Even if its almost identical to GIMP. I like the new branding, it's just cooler and can be taken more seriously by those new to Open-Source/Linux or professionals who have decided to leave Photoshop/Adobe/Mac/PC. I hope they make more changes in future.

Not the fault of the app, but the fault of the crappy Snap system. Install it and it cannot access any files. What is the point of that? I have a feeling it would be good if I could open files on my various drives. Can we please have a non-snap version.
use GIMP, not this.

These individuals steal GNU code and do not change the base software in any meaningful way. They then apply a restricting moral code upon it which is extremely vague and legally overstretching. It is essentially goes in the same direction as the United States 1922 Hays Code, albeit less restrictive. The hypocrisy arises in using Gimps contributors code for updates, contributors which are not bound by these ad hoc post hoc permissions. 'Star Trek: Voyagers' 102nd episode "Nothing Human" is a more extreme analogy to this lack of moral forethought. Honestly, I find it sad that it is even provided through any open source repository. Please support Gimp and not these individuals. If you need a photo editor which works similarly to 'Adobe Lightroom' then 'Raw Therapee' is an excellent consideration.
Why just fork GIMP, rename it and publish?
Doesn't even have a hotkey to crop to selection. Joke program for trash users
Works great and looks great. A model for other projects to learn from.
I have no idea what any of the comments are talking about...
Just renamed the code of the software GIMP because someone didn't like the name.
But in name only. No UI or UX improvements as yet, so hard to mark it any better than GIMP.
I expect Glimpse is going to work great on standard resolution displays, but on HiDPI (mine is ~290dpi), the user interface becomes unstably fiddly.
This pathetic SJW pap does nothing to further the project.
Rebranding an existing project and calling it yours isn't cool

Not to take away from all of the hard work poured into it... but the branding and name of GIMP just scream "please don't use me!" 

As a graphic designer, why would you use something with such terrible branding and a lame logo?  Would you hire a house builder who lives in a shack? Only in the weird GNU world do people think that's okay.  This is a small but significant step in the right direction.
summary: I'm onboard with the name change

description: still has a bit to go in updates but looking forward to them
Interface is total copy of GIMP.
for me the only problem is the missing HiDPI support. Otherwise better than GIMP - but HiDPI MUST be fixed, as it affects UX a lot..
summary: Very good alternative to GIMP - needs HiDPI support!

description:
Note that a large portion of the negative ratings are based on folks who do not seem to recognize the professional importance of not using a word that in common use references either adult content or a person with a physical disability. Honestly, it was embarrassing to have to reference the use of the program to anybody who wasn't already familiar with what it meant in the software world.

Also of note is this excerpt from the Glimpse FAQ:

"Do you intend to replace the GNU Image Manipulation Program?

No, this project does not intend to supplant the GNU Image Manipulation Program. You may have noticed we already link to their donations page throughout our documentation and we periodically donate a portion of our own funds to the upstream project."

For the people complaining about the "political correctness:" That was only a part of this. Primarily, this aims to be (in the future) a redesign of UI/UX and the like. It was just forked...it isn't there yet, is all.

Is this just a fork of Gimp? What the hell? 
Just use Gimp.
Works the same as others and looks great.
summary: I like the naming and can understand its purpose for youth

description:
Why do so many major Linux projects have such questionable brands? Maybe it's due to the gratis-community nature of open source software, or perhaps it's due to a chronic lack of taste of computer scientists. What is undeniable is that many prominent projects have maintained brands that were already outdated in 2005. 

I, for one, do not care about the nonsensical concern the glimpse team has for the s*xu*lly-exotic or physically-impaired individuals that are allegedly up in arms about their slurs being appropriated by GNU devs. I do, however, deeply care about the real and measurable effect that brands have on users. 

I think it is high time that we, as an open-source community, injected a little bit of design into our projects. 

I am looking at you libre office.
summary: GIMP as a brand, has an irronic lack of s*x apeal

description: Lol! Amazing how triggered some people get when offensive words are substituted for. As if they have nothing better to worry about than a name change.

Maybe it's due to this version being a Snap, but G'Mic won't show in Glimpse. Otherwise it's Gimp with a different name and splash screen. I'd say unless you're really sensitive about the name for some reason, just keep using Gimp, at least for now. If Glimpse offers complete compatibility with plugins at some point, and/or it evolves into something different with its own appeal, then I'd try it again.
Wonderful to have an increased focus on UI design, and a name that is no longer aimed at eliciting childish sniggering. Finally, an image editor that I can recommend!
Glimpse actually has less built-in features than GIMP because they removed the "fun" brushes, like the iconic pepper. Please do not waste your time with this.
No reason for this. Use GIMP.
Bruh this is literally the same thing as gimp. I bet the creater copy-pasted the file.
I do really LIKE this version of GIMP. More smooth and very slick.
Why does this exist and why is it in this store?
Thid is an awesome software.
The original is much better and better supported. This is an inferior copy.
Good on you for releasing this fork! I'm very happy with the functionality, design and name of the app

Its actually GIMP.
What am i to reveiw, name and icon?
Name is decent but nothing special and since i have no problem with its original name GIMP its all the same to me. IMO this name would fit more to program where you can observe preview of something, not edit it. Might have more sense if it was browser of pictures displayed as thumnails.
Only thing that is better IMO is program icon.
glimpse is a welcome brand upgrade to the old name and goofy mascot of its predecessor.
summary: great brand glowup for an excellent app

description:
Works well enough.

An aside not at all relevant to how the app works:
As a non-native speaker, I didn't know what the original GIMP name means. Now I do and I'd just say that it was a sad, embarrassing attempt at being "clever" that my teenage self (whom I wholly disavow) would have found "clever" too. Renaming it should have been a no-brainer instead of a non-reason for people to give 1-star reviews.
Excellent name, works great
I can wotk with it easier than gimp.
Does exactly what I need
This application should not exist. Forking things for no good reason keeps FOSS software behind
summary: A pointless fork of GIMP. Just install GIMP

description: Love it. Thanks to the rebrand I can see a lot of potential here for schools to get away from proprietary editors. I am interested to see the coming changes to the fork, as well.
summary: The most powerful image editor for Linux

description:
It works as intended; a back-ported version of the GNU Image Manipulation Program with the name changed in order to provide something more welcoming for the user.

Ignore the people giving this 1-star simply for the name -- they're just being obnoxious. If the GIMP name bothers you, here's an app for you. If it doesn't, cool, go use the other one.

On a purely functional note, it works fine. And that's what matters.
summary: Works perfectly fine. Also, the name change is good

description: It has not been bad so far.

Thought about that GIMP name offends someone I prefer to use Glimpse. I wish a success in long perspective. For next more tolerant generation it is a better choice. Suspect it will be taked as a base name for future releases of GIMP.
summary: I fully support changing the name

description: A powerful image editing tool, with a name I don't have to explain, defend, or be embarrassed about.

As a long-time GIMP user, I am appreciative that there is a version of the software without the embarrassing and inappropriate name. I am much more comfortable recommending this software in educational and professional contexts now.

I appreciate your efforts.
I used GIMP before I was injured. Now I understand.

GIMP was never going to take off. They missed out on tons of funding and adoption over something as arbitrary as a name. I know they put a lot of work into it, but they built it on bad ground, it can't be used as a runway to fly off with, so to say.
summary: People hate to admit how necessary this is to exist

description: An identical 1:1 copy og existing software, with no added value at all. The thing is: Is that hard to say "GIMP menas GNU image manipulation program?" or we should also change GTK name because of this nonsense?

I downloaded this, launched it and then closed it, thinking I launched GIMP instead, I then uninstalled it.

What's the point of this? If you're gonna be a snowflake about a program that had the name for 20 years, then maybe you should avoid going outside.
summary: This seems to be just GIMP with no added value or improvement

description: Worth using just because of who it annoys
Glimpse is very great. Its very fast and I do not understand why people dis like it so much. It has done well on the photos I have work on. :-D
What the point of having two identical software?

As long as we're copying the app and adding nothing to it...

"I downloaded this, launched it and then closed it, thinking I launched GIMP instead, I then uninstalled it.

What's the point of this? If you're gonna be a snowflake about a program that had the name for 20 years, then maybe you should avoid going outside.
YEY another useless fork just to change the name.
summary: I think this is a joke

description:
This fork is a huge improvement on the ugly and inflexible GNU Image Manipulation Program: it launches faster, looks better, and is focused on improving the user experience. 

For me at least, watching a bunch of myopic whiners freak out about the nature of this project only makes it more fun to use. A million thanks to the developers, I'm sorry you get so much flack, keep up the great work!
Works great, and I appreciate the more professional name.
I thought it was odd to copy and past a project with an SJW friendly name but at least expected everything to work the same. I was wrong. GIMP works better. Nice try though I guess. lol
summary: Bugs, especially with theme colors. SJWs fail again

description:
So this thing will always be made on a older version of GIMP? (check out the "about" in the help menu)

I don't see the point to get Glimpse 0.2 based on the GIMP 2.10.18 were the actual GIMP version is 2.10.22 with unique tools like vignette, non destructive crop and so on... that this Glimpse do not have!

In the end I found Glimpse useless as it will be always build on older version of GIMP without the new GIMP's tools, I removed it.
summary: A copy of a previous version of GIMP? What's the point?

description: Not sure what happened. But ever since the Ubuntu Focal update, this app refuses to work anymore. The loading screen pops up, finishes, the application itself then proceeds to open - for about 2 seconds - and immediately crashes and closes. Not sure why. Haven't looked into any of the debug info. Honestly that requires a little more effort than I'm willing to give at this point. Oh well, looks like I'll be going back to GIMP. Too bad, this app had promise at one point. Uninstalled.
summary: Would be great if it didn't crash 2 secs after opening

description: Does everything the other one does, and it's not a slur!
Many people don't seem to understand the importance of branding. I always hated gimp's name and icon

People need to stop being so sensitive about when other people try to improve nomenclature for sh*t in tech and make things more accessible. Not only is this using a stable version of the GNU Image Manipulator, but it also has a cooler name.
summary: Works perfectly fine and has a more accessible name!

description: It's like GIMP but the branding feels more modern and professional compared to it. It *is* based on GIMP 2.10 I believe and I hope to see the project make some new features of it's own that make it better than GIMP in more than just the branding.
summary: Like GIMP, but with professional branding

description: It's a flatpak so I thought it would run slow or its UI clashing with Fedora but it works great.
Its a nice image editor and I don't have to be embarrased to talk about it in polite company. A+

i loved glimps with its verity of tools. i feel this is a great alternitive for adobe ilustrator in linux ubutu .
i had just switched from win 10 to ubuntu 20.04 and this is the best photo editor i could find. with days of testing and searching this is the only photo editor i could find that is this good.
summary: i love the ui and i fell it is a great photo editor

description: Worthless, not a single redeeming quality that justifies its existence separate from GIMP.
rename gimp all you want but have the decency to keep the pepper at least
... I don't have to think about Pulp Fiction every time I edit a picture.
summary: Thanks for making it so that . .

description: it's gimp by troons

Yes, it's mostly just GIMP with new branding and some settings changed. People do not understand that branding like logos and names are extremely important if we want Linux to be mainstream. Things like W.I.N.E. meaning "Wine Is Not an Emulator" are smart and fun but not easily understood.

This is why Proton was a game changer. Not only did the code change the gaming landscape, but the branding "clicked" and was easy to understand.

The name GIMP leaves a bad first impression... The GIMP team does not make want to change their branding no matter how much feedback is given, making this the only other option. This has my full support.
summary: A good "fork" that i very needed

description: better name, better logo :3
Get someone else code developed in the last 20 years. Change logo and name. Call it yours. Profit.
summary: You can call a fork, you can call a theft

description: tried it again and still unable to print the size I want
looks nice! good job

Some say it's flattery when one copies another. Some call it thievery. This could be either, or both.

Based on this projects very own FAQ page, I'm compelled to leave a review.

The bottom line is this: to complain about a logo or a name that you don't like because it "could be" this or it "could be" that and switch to an unproven fork by an unproven team is absolute insanity. Or is that also too offensive for this candy-coated project? How about absurd, can we agree on that one?

This is why Micro$oft wins, folks. Because we don't like a long-standing name and tradition with a proven track record that has served countless people for a very long time, so we cancel them.

Seriously...who cares what it's called. GIMP is bullet-proof and I for one will not betray them for their years of hard work that rivals any high dollar software out there, or any cheap, copycat knock-off for that matter.
GAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY

Glimpse is a long-needed refactoring of a feature-rich but confusingly presented program. Forking is a normal and healthy part of an open-source project, and when you contribute code to such a project, it is understood that the code may be taken and incorporated into future projects with different goals than the original.

However, the Glimpse project's existence is an implicit criticism of the original project's refusal to address its name. It's fine to disagree with the position of this project, but leaving a 1 star review for software that is almost functionally identical to one you like just because they don't much care for your DaNk MeMeS is juvenile. No one is forcing you to use it.

Without fail, I would get weird looks when I brought up the old project to someone who hadn't heard of it before. Glimpse is simply open-source software doing what it's supposed to do: adapting to the needs of its users.
summary: Quit whining that some people don't want to use a program named "GIMP"

description: This is a bad skin of gimp which tried to be more apealing, but wasn't. I love the light mode, though.

As a GIMP user since 1998, Glimpse is wonderful.  For those who voiced their displeasure with the app... 

Maybe, the problem is "Operator or User Error!"

Bis auf, dass die in den letzten vier Monaten nur den Namen geändert haben wie GIMP eine solide Software. Ich schau mal wie es sich entwickelt und ob es dann entsprechend GIMP ersetzen kann. Mir wurde von den Entwicklern bestätigt, dass sie weitere Features einführen werden.
Its called Gimp! and Gimp is a great product, stop the millenial ideology
Why do you change a running system? That makes no sence!

Hey guys,
see many people who say "it's actually gimp" - yea it is. Gimp said we're going to change our name cause "GIMP" means "GNU image manipulation programm" - they wanted to change it because it is no longer just a manipulation programme
so it is no fake or clone 
thx
summary: Yea, it's gimp, but gimp was OFFICIALLY changed to glimpse

description: billige Kopie von Gimp
Why would you complain about a free software that is a fork of another free software? Thats what it is all about!
summary: Forking is at the heart of free software

description:
Ein nutzloser Fork von GIMP, dessen einziger Unterschied bisher Name, Splashscreen und Versionsnummer sind!

A fork of GIMP, with the only difference by now being the name and version number, because some prudish btches of political correctness did not like the ambigous name of the original. But at least by now, as a GIMP user there is no reason to switch to Glimpse, since it has no advantages.

well, some problems are existing, some are easy to solve,some not. it is totally ok to fork free software. get over it! i hope, this fork exists for some longer time. and to the critics: stop trying to actively ignore it and "talk it away" like some priests try to heal, convert or talk away what they think is offensive. that is _not_ very male or non-millenial ,too.
Glimpse is a better name, has a nicer icon and takes unnecassary stuff out of GIMP
The program is called gimp. This fork is worthless in my opinion. Go and support GIMP the original gnu image manipulaton program
...it's GIMP... lol ?️
Why Fork a perfectly good product?
Es gibt schon GIMP, und irgendwas wegen irgendwelchen zweifelhaften ideologischen gründen ein Projekt spalten!

Die Kurzbeschreibung erwähnt die Batch-Verarbeitung. Diese ist im installierten Pogramm nicht auffindbar. Die Hilfe wird nicht installiert. Die Online-Hilfe kann nicht aufgerufen werden. So will ich die Software nicht verwenden. Gern wieder, wenn sie fertig ist.
GIMP is a good tool. No need for political correctness Glimpse
Concentrate on the original gimp.. not that ideology s.....
aber der Name 'Gimp' ist schlicht und ergreifend nicht korrekt. Jeder der nur ein bißchen Verstand hat installiert sich einfach Gimpse und gut is.
summary: Für die ewig Gestrigen natürlich nichts,

description: Glimpse ist der gleiche Aufguss wie GIMP. Das Programm selbst ist intuitiv bedienbar. Die Konzentration auf Speicherformat xcf macht einen Austausch der bearbeitbaren Daten mit anderen Programmen unmöglich. Lieber jpeg ,tiff und Raw implementieren und dann weiterentwickeln.
Lässt GIMP und die GIMP-Entwikler in ruhe! Macht was sinvolles!

wether the reasons are ideology or changing of the meaning of the name eg per sm gimps, or wether it is just personal tast, or someone wants to correct some mistakes for better usability for himself, or... that is, what makes open source cool. that is freedom. (btw: and that is, what we need for audacity now - an open source alternative. it won't be audacity anymore, and maybe someone wants to revive jokosher, or maybe someone..) get over it and keep your own ideologies, semi hate comments and explanations for yourself: this project corrected some bugs and - for me - it is even better than gimp.
summary: it is absolutely ok to fork a project

description:
Creo que la interfaz gráfica de GIMP está muy anticuada. Los desarrolladores de este proyecto van a sacar una nueva interfaz gráfica escrita desde cero. 

Esto les llevará unos años, pero mejor tarde que nunca.

Abandonar GIMP por el nombre me parece fatal despues de tantos años llamandose GIMP ahora hay que cambiarle el nombre porque en algunos paises GIMP suena despectivo. se van a dedicar a copiar GIMP en cada versión y poco mas... bueno ya se verá.
The main motivation of this project is the GIMP name and SJW agendas... not worth it right now IMHO.
summary: Just a fork without any added value... for now?

description: no added value at all, a meaningless fork

If you are basically forking GIMP just because of a pointeless semantic reason, please DON'T. GNU Image Manipulation Program doesn't means what you are intending here. and I don't even see a fork here. Just a recompiled GIMP with another name. It may last a glimpse.
Se trata de Gimp pero con nombre nuevo debido a problemas con el nombre
Nada que objetar.
Sólo quiero saber eso.
summary: ¿Esta app es lo mismo que gimp?

description: La verdad es que le falta en cuestión a UXa glimpse, pero al menos lo intentan. No se merece los comentarios tan nefastos que estoy leyendo, así que les van mis 5 estrellas.
summary: Al fin quitan ese icono horrible

description:
If you think that a GNU project can benefit from a better iterface as everyone should know you can get involved and make that by being part of it. Now, what do we have here? This has no added value at all.

1- UI/UX is the same, yet this people promises "a better interface" they just removed the gimp logo. Basically, you removed the word "GIMP" and related images and recompiled it? get something better to do. plagiarism is not good.

2-GIMP (GNU Image Manipulation program) is an acronym. Why to bother about weird sensibilities when anyone should know what GIMP stands for. Is not porn, is software and the name is not a blasphemy.

3- Do you want to do something useful? quit the rebranding process and go for GPU support to handle a lot of layers and huge images. That would be an improvement. 

Vredict: Don't waste your time. For the time being GIMP will not use OpelCL due to certain issues but on the mid/short term it will probably do. GIMP already had a refresh on GIMP 2.10 so quit the useless UI argument. 

worthless.

En serio. ¿Alguien se imagina que el software (o cualquier otro producto del tipo que sea: alimentación, automóviles, etc.) deba examinarse a través de las cientos (o miles) de lenguas existentes en el mundo con el fin de no ofender a nadie? Un ejemplo es el nuevo Hyundai Kona. La "cona" en gallego significa coño, o vagina si ustedes lo prefieren. "A cona que te pareu!" es una expresión popular en la Galicia rural que no creo necesite traducción. ¿Alguien entendería que la marca coreana cambiara el nombre por dicho asunto? Por favor... Este proyecto es sencillamente ridículo y le hace un flaco favor al software libre.

It's just GIMP, but with a better logo, a better name, without the ugly background, and without the "you can drop dockable dialogs here" permanent message under the toolbox, which are literally the few things I didn't like about GIMP, so this fork is perfect for me.

There isn't much more to it, but I hope this project gets somewhere, since they already made GIMP feel a bit more modern and clean.
Gimp avec une nouvelle icône, super !
summary: Gimp avec une nouvelle icône, super !

description: C'est GIMP, mais avec un nouveau nom. Le'original est très bon, préférez le à ce fork inutile juqte pour changer un titre et une icone
Problème pour installer et faire fonctionne G'mic sous Glimpse avec Ubuntu 19.10
On retrouve toutes les fonctionnalités de GIMP avec une interface et un logo améliorés. Il est très rapide.
Ce "fork" n'apporte rien.
A priori seuls l’icône et la mascotte changent...
Si il est basé sur Gimp, il est beaucoup plus rapide que lui_
Un fork de GIMP assez inutile (mais qui met sa page "donate" en avant, avec le code des autres...
Comment installer le paquet G'mic ?
C'est gimp mais avec un autre nom...
longt à s'installer pour à peine 300Mo (ubuntu 20.04) l'interface semble hostère, peut-etre pas en francais, ni personnalisable..mieux vaut rester sur photofiltre via Wine, je crois.

Glimpse ne sert pas à grand chose pour l'instant à mes yeux, il vaut mieux utiliser GIMP.

Leurs projet Glimpse NX semble quand même vachement plus intéressant.
Glimpse ne sert à rien d'autre que proposer un niveau nom à mes yeux. 

Après à l'usage y'a rien qui justifie Glimpse, j'ai pas vraiment un gain en performance qui là par contre aurait pu lui donné un gros intérêt.

Gimp, en moins moche, les fonctionnalités un peu moins planquées sous les tuyaux. Pas de grandes différences en termes de performances mais merci d'avoir pensé au design. Ce serait bien des fois qu'on s'y intéresse dans l'open source et que ce ne soit pas toujours synonyme de moche.
Glimpse ressemble beaucoup à Gimp (normal, il est basé sur lui) mais je trouve qu'il a des meilleurs performances et une interface un peu plus épurée.

Нельзя имея основной, качественный в мире linux пакет для графики не принимать участие в его развитии, вместо этого форкать его, просто изменяя название. Такие действия могут потенциально привести к ухудшению качества продукта.
Установил и просто пользуюсь. Мне нравится. До этого гимпом пользовался, но там помню надо было произвести изначально какие-то настройки, чтобы удобно было. Изначально в гимпе все плохо.
Тот же гимп. Мне нравится.
Пользуюсь уже полгода, полёт нормальный. Мне нравится, а описания работы те же ,что и в гимпе.

1. согласен с Павлом. Упыри...
2. это графический редактор, не имеющий никакого отношения к фото..
